review_title: Leadership is Committed to Employee Well-Being and Social Equity
job_title: Attorney in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Dr. Bruton's leadership throughout over two years of the pandemic has been inspirational. CCI still served over 60,000 patients and clients per year during the COVID crisis, all while keeping its employees safe through testing protocols, masking--including N-95 masks--and cleaning protocols. Management has offered employees self-care hours and mental health days, while also allowing for flexible schedules and access to remote work for all employees on a rotational basis.
cons: No workplace is perfect. Because of workforce shortages affecting all of healthcare, sometimes there have been vacancies which have been unfilled for longer than is ideal.

review_title: BEST CEO! Best Place to Work! Great Benefits! Opportunity for Growth!
job_title: Director of Strategic Initiatives in Silver Spring, MD
pros:
CCI Health Services is the best place to work. I call it my second home. The people that I work with are like family to me. Every morning when I get up, I look forward to going to work. When I walked into the health center, I could feel the warm welcome from the team. Everyone works together towards the same common goal, which is to take care of each other so we can take great care of our patients. My CEO is one of the most remarkable women I have known. She is caring, kind, and courageous, and she will always have your back. She makes herself available to anyone in the company. You have to go to her and say whatever you need to say. She is for the people and the patients.
Don't let yourself get discouraged by the bad reviews that people have written about her. They are not valid! These people never dared to speak their minds while employed by CCI and found the need to use this type of platform as a type of retaliation. What type of human being are you that you have to use a review to slander the person you were kissing up to at some point! Coward moves! Remember! Live and Light, People! Life goes round and round, and at some point, you'll need to cross those bridges that you are setting on fire now!
cons: I do not have any cons for CCI. For those who work in healthcare, we are doing the best we can. Healthcare Heroes, we are called!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Silver Spring, MD
pros: There’s always a poly for career growth
cons: No work-life balance, hard to maintain PTO when you have a big family.

review_title: Don’t apply, save yourself the therapy sessions
job_title: Program Coordinator in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Most staff are friendly & committed to serving the patients.
cons: Inexperienced and ego-driven CEO. Nepotism evident by hiring family and friends to high positions without experience or degrees. CEO tolerates bullying of staff and at times participates in berating of subordinates. This place is a revolving door and very little gets accomplished with so many staff leaving and on boarding. Please also see reviews under “CCI Health & Wellness Services” as it’s the same organization and the reviews are no different than here.

job_title: Physician in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Very flexible and where you get rewarded for the job you love to do. Have the best communications with management as well as all staff.
cons: If I have to mention a con would be scheduling.

job_title: Director of Behavioral Health in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Great Leaders ,Provide and Staff Committed to providing a full range of Integrated Health Care at Multiple Locations.
cons: None! Come work for us! We are hiring!

job_title: Nutrition Assistant in Wheaton, MD
pros:
-Amazing women working in the space!
-Very diverse clientele
cons:
-Does not pay well
-Very rigid rules

job_title: Community Health Worker in Takoma Park, MD
pros: Get your experience and leave.
cons: Leadership. CEO is toxic. Her personality and people skills need work. She may need a hug. Website is not up to date. Its Dr Bruton.

review_title: Great mission and staff, but big management problems
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Staff are very talented, passionate, and diverse people who all want to serve the mission. Decent salary.
cons: Ask any current or prior employee why people decide to leave CCI and they will tell you it was because of the executive team. The executive team is unarguably very passionate about the work and its mission, but uses archaic management techniques like fear, rudeness, and bullying, which keeps people down or forces them out the door. The team literally shouts at people and is the main cause of stress and chaos within the company. Most employees never know where they stand, and generally dislike any interactions with the executive team.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Low cost  for patients
cons: I have been working in this clinic for 4 yrs. Am ready to leave!!! Very disappointing. The company wants us to see a certain number of patients a day, meaning that the care we provide is timed. We get timed for every thing . How can we provide great patient center services??! And when mention at a meeting. We were told . "You are replaceable." Providers, front desk and over all everyone are soo frustrated. So many policies to do and buttons to click. One mistake and you talked to like you are an idiot. I remember when CCI cared about their employees. But after the new management you see people leave every two months. FYI they even took one week away for leave hours. You better hope your children or you do not get sick because there goes your vacation.

job_title: Clinical Psychologist in Silver Spring, MD
pros:
The only pro is the
Hours : 8-4:30
cons:
Unprofessional. COO/CEO regularly accuses people based on gossip and her personal dislikes. She is ruthless !   She recently got her PhD in psychology and psychoanalysis every single employee. She has a character sketch for everyone


This company is looking to
Use you, Underpay you and Throw you out when they don’t need you. The previous review is from a very political nursing director who was recently promoted to COO. Hence, she calls CCI awesome.  The company routinely dictates to heads of various departments to submit positive FAKE reviews, so that people  hwould apply for jobs there. Ask any provider who actually WORKS and treats patients how they feel about the company and the I unanimous answer will be : Terrible company, awful COO/CEO who promotes Toxic work environment.

review_title: A Company with GREAT employees who are under appreciated
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Takoma Park, MD
pros: Great population of patients to work with- community health at its core.  Amazing and dedicated staff who believe that health care is a right for all.
cons: Management does not seem to respect or listen to the staff who are involved in direct patient care.  There is a culture of helplessness, anger and fear.  Emotionally, this has been the most difficult place to work of my career.

job_title: Provider in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Nice Co-workers, mission, diversity and patients.
cons: Doctors, Nurse practitioners and PA should stay away. Yes it is rewarding to care for this population of patients but management is impossible. The COO who is now the new CEO is incompetent; she is like a female Donald Trump. She treats employees like they are dispensable. She has her click and basically is verbally abusive to anyone who challenges her ideas. Most providers leave within one year and those who stay it is for loan repayment purposes or are just looking for their next job. A doctor walked out in the middle of the day that is how bad it is... Stay away at all cost or talk to former employers before signing a contract.

job_title: Director of Operations in Silver Spring, MD
pros: I have been working for CCI Health & Wellness for many years. I call it my second home because that's how I feel when I am around the good people that I share my day with.  I feel that I am working with family. I work with the best team. With CCI I have found my connected purpose which is to change staff and patients  lives . Every day, I feel that I touch someone's even with the smallest gestures.
cons: Family Health Insurance is a little bit pricey. Other than that I am very happy with my benefits, I get a lot of PTO!

job_title: Breastfeeding Peer Counselor in Greenbelt, MD
pros: Great benefits, organized, helps the community
cons: Way too strict, have to give them a month in advance if you want 1 day off, do not care if it’s for your children or what may be going on in your life. I understand there are rules but we are human not robots. If you don’t have at least 16 hours of pto they do not let you take off, you can’t come in early or leave late u have have to clock in and out at exactly the time.

review_title: Proud to Work here and Serve the Community
job_title: Program Coordinator in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Executive leadership has pioneered a vision and direction for CCI that is unparalleled. From the COVID-19 response to the patient centered care that is provided everyday, I am proud to work here and to serve the communities of Montgomery and Prince George's county in the best way possible.
cons: None at this current time

job_title: CPA Nutritionist in Takoma Park, MD
pros: The work environment, the staff, the company, the work itself is very fulfilling.
cons: Long days! You see close to 12 participants daily. If you work faster than other coworkers then you do yourself a disservice. CCI is great, WIC is great, but the combination of the two gets weird and complicated. You feel like you’re not really a part of CCI and not really a part of WIC.

review_title: Worst Company I’ve Ever Worked For
job_title: Manager in Silver Spring, MD
pros: The only reason I’m still here (and others) is I need the paycheck,
cons: Too many to list in my opinion. Please read through all reviews. Try and talk to someone who actually works at CCI before committing to a job offer, you will get a better picture of what working for them is really like. My advice is stay far away. I agree 100% with all the 1-star reviews. If you look closely the positive reviews are either “anonymous” or from leadership team. Use critical thinking here, you’ll thank me later.

review_title: Great mission, committed providers, high burn out
job_title: Physician/Medical Director in Silver Spring, MD
pros: The staff and providers are committed to the patients and the mission of the organization.
cons: The executive team had limited understanding of day to day practice and clinic operations.

job_title: Community Health Worker in Gaithersburg, MD
pros: Great teamwork, patience since this organization is still growing but it has great plans and you will love to form part of this team if you enjoy helping people.
cons: Benefits are not the best, but they try to offer the best for a non-profit which is not bad

review_title: CCI is a great place to work!
job_title: Human Resources Director in Silver Spring, MD
pros: New CEO is navigating well in uncharted COVID-19 waters; great staff, mission oriented work, and 8a.m. to 4:30p.m. culture, good pay and benefits.
cons: Having to operate in this COVID-19 space is the biggest challenge/con, but happy to be working!

job_title: Call Center Manager in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Excellent benefits given to all employees who are eligible. There is job security. Most of all if you give management on suggestions to make the work place better they always listen and try to implement as many as possible.
cons: You are unable to work from home.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Team oriented organization and provides a lot of room for professional growth
cons: Have not had cons in this company yet

cons: Organization is continuously improving.

review_title: Rewarding place to work and grow.
